      • quickSort

        public static void quickSort​(int[] arr,
                             int[] ranking)
        This method sorts an array of int (usual quickSort) It also keeps track of the movement of the elements. ranking[i] contains the initial index of the element now at index i in arr
        Parameters:
        arr - Array to sort
        ranking - Array containing the initial positions of elements.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the number of inversions in a permutation array (which is the number of pairs i< j such that perm[i]> perm[j]

      • compo

        public static int[] compo​(int[] p,
                          int[] q)
        Returns the array representing function composition q o p if lengths match, 0 otherwise
        Parameters:
        p - a permutation array which values must also be valid indexes.
        q - a permutation array
        Returns:
        The array representing function composition q o p if lengths match, 0 otherwise
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if a value in p is not an index of q

      • pow

        public static int[] pow​(int[] fct,
                        int exp)
        Returns the exp'th power of the function represented by perm
        Parameters:
        fct - an array representing a function that maps i to perm[i] for all i in [0,perm.length-1] (all values of perm must also be in that interval to avoid aioobe exceptions)
        exp - the exponent
        Returns:
        The exp'th power of the function represented by perm

      • pow

        public static int[][] pow​(int[][] set,
                          int exp)
        Returns an array res such that res[i]=pow(set[i],exp) for all i in [0,set.length-1]
        Parameters:
        set -
        exp -
        Returns:
        An array res such that res[i]=pow(set[i],exp) for all i in
        See Also:
        pow(int[],int)

      • respectCycle

        public static boolean respectCycle​(int[] tab,
                                   int[] cycle)
        Returns true if values in cycle appears in its periodic order in tab, false otherwise. More precisely, let us define pInv=inverse(tab). Then, the method returns true if and only if only one of these inequalities is false: pInv[cycle[0]]< pInv[cycle[1]]< pInv[cycle[2]]< ... pInv[cycle[cycle.length-1]]< pInv[cycle[0]].
        Parameters:
        tab - a permutation array
        cycle - an array that must contain valid indexes of tab
        Returns:
        true if values in cycle appears in its periodic order in tab, false otherwise.

      • respectCycles

        public static boolean respectCycles​(int[] tab,
                                    int[][] cycles)
        Returns true if respectCycle(tab, cycle) return true for all cycle in cycles
        Parameters:
        tab -
        cycles -
        Returns:
        true if respectCycle(tab, arr) return true for all arr in cycles
        See Also:
        respectCycles(int[] tab, int[] cycles)
